head.title: Fourth Hilton in China Opens in Dalian

hedline.hl1: Fourth Hilton in China Opens in Dalian

abstract.p: Hilton opens its fourth hotel in China, 372-room establishment in Dalian; map (S)

block.p: Hilton has opened its fourth hotel in China, what will be a 372-room establishment in Dalian, the major northeastern port city 300 miles east of Beijing on Korea Bay. The 36-story hotel is in the Chang Jiang Commercial Complex, which includes an apartment building and an office tower, on the harbor.

The hotel, which opened in August, had 252 rooms available early this month, with the others scheduled to be ready by the end of October, a Hilton spokeswoman said. Public areas include a pyramid-shaped crystal fountain separating an indoor garden from the lobby, and displays of contemporary Chinese art.

Hilton has opened its fourth hotel in China, what will be a 372-room establishment in Dalian, the major northeastern port city 300 miles east of Beijing on Korea Bay. The 36-story hotel is in the Chang Jiang Commercial Complex, which includes an apartment building and an office tower, on the harbor.

The hotel, which opened in August, had 252 rooms available early this month, with the others scheduled to be ready by the end of October, a Hilton spokeswoman said. Public areas include a pyramid-shaped crystal fountain separating an indoor garden from the lobby, and displays of contemporary Chinese art.

Two restaurants are open: Intermezzo -- featuring buffets and tandoori specialties -- and the Red Lotus, serving Cantonese, Hangzhou and Dalian cuisine. There is a business center, and a fitness center with an indoor pool and tennis court is nearly ready.
The Dalian, 123 Chang Jiang Road, (86-411) 252-9999, fax (86-411) 252-9900, is offering an introductory rate of $68 for a standard single or double room through October. Reservations: (800) 774-1500.
